column4: i have a problem w/ my comp booting from extr drive instead of internal drive
: check your computer's bios,... change your boot order
: are you sure,.... if you are then, are you sure you have an os on your internal drive?
the external usb drive is on the very buttom...lol. yes i have a os :)
its only on bootup. i have to unplug it before it goes to grub and then its all fine
: lol,... i'm not sure then,... i'd double check my bios,... there is no reason your computer should only boot to the external. try getting rid of your external boot option in your bios all together.
how do i go about doing that? it doesnt seem to have that option
on every computer,... while it's booting up,... it gives you options,... on some is the DEL key on other F10 on other F12,.... press whatever button gets you into your bios and change your boot order
: careful while your in there though,....
collabr: i understad that i mean is how do i completly remove that option?
my other comp works fine its only on this compaq
ah,.. that depends on the bios,... most allow you to change or delete boot up options
like i said i can change the order but not remove the device...also can i see the bios after i bootup(inside hperterminnal)
and changing the boot order doesn't solve your problem?
: that's strange,... i'd take a second look,... sorry i couldn't help you
